title: Bug 113047 - No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children node is not listed.
EB: The children node should be listed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement. 
2. Ensure the new data source has no database/table/column information. 
3. Observe that there is no children node listed when changing the data source for the data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. 
4. Close the data set editor and reopen it. 
5. Verify that the children node is still not listed when changing the data source.
